entry.title: Pashinyan accused of questioning Armenian Genocide

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan accused of questioning Armenian Genocide
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan sparked outrage with statements that appeared to question aspects of the Armenian Genocide. üìç Armenia's major strategy focuses on preventing a war with Azerbaijan; the Armenian government is optimistic about the ongoing border delimitation process and no critical infrastructure will be ceded to Baku, Pashinyan said. üìç Deputy Foreign Minister of Armenia Vahan Kostanyan is on a visit to Syria, where he met with the country‚Äôs newly appointed Foreign Minister. üìç Young Syrian Armenians in Yerevan: Assad has fallen, what next: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/814032/young-syrian-armenians-in-yerevan-assad-has-fallen-what-next/

media:group.media:title: Russia and Iran sanctions limit Armenia‚Äôs economy, intelligence officials warn:THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç The World Bank Group approved a new strategy with around $1.2-$1.7 billion over the next five years to support sustainable economic development in Armenia. üìç International sanctions on Russia and Iran limit Armenia‚Äôs economic growth potential, according to Armenia‚Äôs Foreign Intelligence Service.

üìç The likelihood of a large-scale Azerbaijani military attack on Armenia in 2025 is considered low, according to a report today by Armenia‚Äôs Foreign Intelligence Service. üìç In Davos, Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan described Armenia as both interested in joining the European Union, but careful of maintaining a balance in relations with all its partners. üìç CivilNet has filed a cross claim against Yerevan Mayor Tigran Avinyan, demanding a public apology from him for referring to the media in the country as ‚Äúa big garbage dump.‚Äù

entry.title: International silence over Azerbaijan's kangaroo courts

media:group.media:title: International silence over Azerbaijan's kangaroo courts
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian shines a spotlight on the deeply disturbing Stalinist-style show trials being staged by the Azerbaijani regime against Armenian hostages. Hacopian dissects the international community's muted response, the Armenian government's shameful silence, and the urgent need for a robust, multi-pronged strategy to confront this egregious violation of human rights. The episode also unpacks the significance of the recently signed US-Armenia strategic agreement, addressing misconceptions and underscoring its geopolitical implications.
